I won't deny that it usually hooks me, but it also takes the impact out of the reveals when they naturally come up.I'm taking the time to‚Ä¶

Really beautiful movie. It feels inaccurate to call it experimental, but some of the editing effects and pops of color are incredibly well done and artful. It reminds me of playing around with different plug-ins and image overlays in an editing program - though obviously the people making this didn't have anything near that kind of technology (and yet it still looks incredible). Also really enjoyed seeing the fair footage, especially the old timey rollercoaster. The story is nothing special, and that's why I'm not rating this any higher, but the connection between the two protagonists is sweet nonetheless.

After a full film of over-the-top humor and CGI unicorns the emotion of the final scenes just don‚Äôt land at all.

Well shot and acted, but excruciatingly slow paced. It certainly doesn‚Äôt help that it‚Äôs near impossible to approach this movie with ‚Äúfresh‚Äù eyes after existing in the world and online for thirty years. The majority of the film‚Äôs major scenes are things I‚Äôd already seen either literally, as direct clips from the film, or through parody. Watching just felt like filling in the blanks‚Ä¶and the blanks were often full of long, dry conversations. ‚Ä¶Like I genuinely fell asleep during an‚Ä¶

There‚Äôs a lot here that‚Äôs really great. An undeniably amazing performance by Ewan McGregor, paired with some of the most energetic, high octane editing put to film.¬†Unfortunately I think that that editing, along with some of the film‚Äôs more surreal moments, ultimately do a disservice to its emotional weight for me. Everything‚Äôs moving so fast that it‚Äôs hard to really take in the movie‚Äôs more harrowing moments. I get why it‚Äôs done that way - it‚Äôs how McGregor‚Äôs character and‚Ä¶

Not sure which I liked better between this andThe Collector. Each have their pros and cons which equal out to about the same enjoyment level for me. The visuals and bold use of color/shadows are still what set the series apart from other movies of the same subgenre. Pretty cool sets in this one too. You can tell they had a little bit more budget to play with.
cay rivvers the woman that you are

movietitle: Glitter and Greed: The Lisa Frank Story
review: On Thursday I was tired and wanted to throw on something relatively mindless that would just keep me awake for theSeverancefinale. Ended up going with this and just got around to watching the final episode today.As with a lot of these docuseries, this likely could have been condensed into a feature length film and been better paced as a result - the only issue I see with this is the modern story of Lisa Frank screwing over‚Ä¶

This Alamo screening couldn't have come at a better time! I just started reading 'Now You See It' by Richard Dyer, which is about gay/lesbian film made prior to 1980. Ironically, it is written by a man (albeit, a gay man) - something it shares with the 'Hollywood Lesbians' book that Cheryl gets in theThe Watermelon Woman.It's undeniable that this movie has "first feature" written all over it. The film is comprised of a series of (occasionally disjointed)‚Ä¶

There's a lot aboutOpusthat worked for me, but I can't deny that, at times, it felt like little more than an echo of films likeThe Menuand (more clearly, though the timing feels impossible)Blink Twice. Nonetheless, I seem to be in the minority in thinking that it generally handles its narrative better than either of the other two films. It doesn't wholly stick the landing (an issue with all three) but its ending also doesn't make‚Ä¶

The Collectoris simultaneously of its time and remarkably unique, particularly in terms of its visuals. The editing lands somewhere betweenSawandFinal Destination- with crazy kills to match - but with some of the boldest coloring decisions I‚Äôve seen in a film of this ilk. It mostly works in its favor. The imagery is consistently striking and memorable, even when there isn't intense horror on-screen.That said, the sheer amount of torture/trap scenes do very little for‚Ä¶

Kind of a strange movie in that I‚Äôm not sure if it was trying to be Catholic propaganda to some degree or if it just went way too hard on the devil/god angle. Either way, I did enjoy a lot of the build up here. The jumpscares and scenes of prolonged darkness can feel kind of cheap, but the tension was otherwise built well and I did become invested in how they were gonna get them out of there. ‚Ä¶But‚Ä¶

I was excited to watch this one, but it ended up being far too slow paced for me. Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland both give good performances, but it's not nearly as engaging as it should be considering the central mystery.
Briskly-paced to the point of feeling like an episode of a television show, but it‚Äôs a well written ‚Äúepisode.‚Äù Love the drama.

I wasn‚Äôt really feeling this movie at first, but I warmed up to it pretty quickly. It‚Äôs equal parts charming, cringey, and relatable - which makes sense, considering it‚Äôs led and directed by someone the same age as its protagonists.

Gun Crazy‚Äôs influence onBonnie and Clydeis abundantly clear from the moment its protagonists decide to go on a crime spree but, unfortunately, I sawBonnie and Clydefirst so this kinda just felt like an off brand ‚Äúwe‚Äôve gotBonnie and Clydeat home.‚Äù¬†Fortunately,Bonnie and Clydeis a good movie‚Ä¶ so another movie with a similar set-up is bound to also be pretty good. There‚Äôs some cool shots in here as well, and I did enjoy the set-up of its characters differing outlooks on life (and guns).

Unintentional Barbara Stanwyck double feature.It‚Äôs clear from the outset how the film is going to end up, but it‚Äôs a little hard to believe when Gary Cooper is so stiff and boring in this. The band of old men working on the encyclopedia with him are more charming!Thankfully, Barbara Stanwyck ensures that the film is still an enjoyable watch in spite of her flatly written and performed leading man. üíÉ

The Parentingbegan production back in 2022 so, in the age of failed projects becoming tax write-offs, I had pretty much accepted that I'd never get to see it...and I'm very happy to have been wrong about that!The film is a strange project for (HBO) Max, as it definitely feels like something that would be more at home on a less "prestigious" service, but it's nonetheless a fun time with a surprisingly stacked cast of actors. A silly and over-the-top horror comedy with just enough drama to ground its characters in a relatable reality.

I was kind of surprised to look at the crew list and see that this was written by Lars Von Trier and directed by the man who madeThe HuntandAnother Round. I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve loved everything the two filmmakers have made individually, but I‚Äôd at least expect something they collaborated on to be more interesting than this. ‚Ä¶Though, I‚Äôll admit, Von Trier‚Äôs influence becomes extremely clear in the film‚Äôs bleak ending.The characters here are all obnoxious hipsters‚Ä¶

Didn‚Äôt go into this with very high expectations, but it‚Äôs a fun ride. Jack Quaid is very likable in the lead role, and Matt Walsh (not that one) is a master at delivering his limited dialogue in a way that maximizes its humor. Action movies aren‚Äôt really my thing, but I think they‚Äôre generally better when the fights are over-the-top and cartoonish like these. Lots of sprayed blood, unconventional weapons, and thudding sound effects. Good time at the movie theater.

I wasn‚Äôt sure how I‚Äôd feel about this one, but was pleasantly surprised by it. A lot of broad, silly comedy that works not only because of funny writing but because of just how endearing its characters are. Barf‚Äôs tail wags and ear movement are good examples of things that are (almost) consistently ‚Äúcute‚Äù that aren‚Äôt necessarily necessary for the comedy or plot but which make his character, and the movie, all the more likable. Also a fan of theAlienscene, even if it feels tacked on for the sake of the gag and not much more.Good, dumb fun!
longest 13 minutes of my life
Goes on for too long and largely loses its charm as a result. Feels very Adult Swim - for better or worse.

Fun take on an old character. Really enjoyed the animation style, particularly the sketchy backgrounds that the characters melted into. Not too fond of Tiger‚Äôs voice actor, but otherwise a pretty solid short animation with a lot of promise.

Charming enough indie drama that wears its inspirations on its sleeves - and, more literally, on its walls ‚Ä¶in the form of movie posters.Unfortunately the girlfailure protagonist and black and white cinematography easily invites comparison toFrances Ha, and its script is nowhere near as strong as its predecessor.Props for being one of the more likable mumblecore films to come out in recent years though.

Pretty cool in-depth look at a pirate radio station that operated out of California. Unfortunately I think it‚Äôs a little too long for the amount of material it has - it could‚Äôve probably even been a 30-40 minute short - but the interviews are fun and the film as a whole is a nice little window into a short-lived niche subculture.

movietitle: A Night at the Rest Area
review: Veryyy cute animation style. I love how all of these guys look and move. Although the story is pretty minimalistic, I also enjoyed it for its universal relatability. A few funny moments in here too. Great short!

The character design here is really cute and inspired me to watch the short, but I was hoping the movement would be more reminiscent of stop motion not‚Ä¶whatever this was. The voice acting also kind of annoyed me. The whole thing kind of has the vibe of a kid on YouTube playing with Littlest Pet Shop toys and narrating, just with original figures instead of LPS.

Not much to say about this short‚Äôs story, but the visual direction is amazing. It appears to all be hand drawn, and the colored pencil(?) backdrops add so much texture and life and contrast so well with the black and white characters.

Very strange movie that doesn‚Äôt really have much going for it beyond being strange.The lockjaw gimmick, paired with the in-world story of how it came to be, makes for a solid mumblecore premise, and it‚Äôs true that there are some funny lines here and there, but all the characters are so consistently weird that it wraps back around to them being totally uninteresting.At a certain point I was only continuing to watch this to be able to say I finished it.

I‚Äôve been eagerly awaiting the release of this documentary since 2022, when I personally added it to TMDb to put it in my watchlist here. While I think I may be a little too knowledgable about its subject to get the same ‚Äúfull experience‚Äù that an outsider would, I still had a lot of fun with it and enjoyed the bits of original content it had to offer. The looks at personal collections and the black market trading going on‚Ä¶
Decent enough premise, but none of the characters really interested me and the pacing felt far too slow considering the film‚Äôs darkly comedic - and, at times, cartoonish - tone. Meh.

This is a movie that I don't think works without some top notch performances, but thankfully everyone here is really giving it their all. I'm not sure I was entirely on board with how one of the film's ending moments played out, but it's hard to care much about the specifics when the raw emotion of the film works so well.

Just as dumb as I expected, but it‚Äôs also very fun so it‚Äôs ok.Lots of surprisingly recognizable faces in this movie, but my favorite cameos were definitely the back to back Jayma Mays and Jane Lynch appearances‚Ä¶ two years beforeGlee!

Mixed bag. Loved when it got a little quirky with it (Alison Pill‚Äôs train car + Tilda Swinton‚Äôs whole thing), but the slow mo action scenes often did nothing for me and the end was a little too explanatory for my liking. Still a solid movie, but not my favorite of Bong Joon-ho‚Äòs by a wide margin.

Incredibly interesting character dynamics trapped in the confines of a pretty run of the mill script. I feel like the story here is held back by reality in a lot of ways, but I do like what they were doing with Billy Crudup‚Äôs character. Uniquely messy and undefined in a way that feels realistic.

I didn‚Äôt fully take in the release date here and so didn‚Äôt realize this was silent‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ I wanted to like it despite that, but had a hard time getting into it. Did not help that it quickly became a love triangle thing. Oh well.Watched on tubi on my flatscreen tv while eating wings, which made me think of how surreal and unbelievable that set up would‚Äôve been to the people who made the film. Clara Bow didn‚Äôt even live to see the VHS, but I can see her movie streamed in 1080p, interrupted with commercials for modern medications. Crazy.

Much likeLonglegs, I really enjoyed the build-up of the first half of this, but thought it dropped the ball by the end. The Adam Scott cameo is fun though, and I really liked Tatiana Maslany in this. Kind of forgot how good she could be afterShe-Hulk, but her bit at the funeral here was one of my favorite scenes. Almost makes me want to go back and finishOrphan Black. Almost.

Love the dialogue in this‚Ä¶ I really hope we see Greta Gerwig and Noah Baumbach team up for a script with the same energy again in the near future. Frances is such a loser, but a loveable one. Also maybe the gayest straight character in cinema history.

Lower has a very unique, singular cinematic voice‚Ä¶ but, unfortunately, it‚Äôs one that doesn‚Äôt really work for me here. Kind of reminds me ofUnicorn Storein that way. Sweet sentiment though, and some neat body art.
forgot how cringe they are. love them. ü¶äüê±

Super cute movie.Although I read the Captain Underpants books as a kid, the Dog Man books were released well past the point of me being in the right demographic for them, so I didn‚Äôt know much about the story or characters. Because of the movie though I did end up seeing a few pages from the books floating around, and was surprised at how much more mature they seemed when compared Pilkey‚Äôs earlier series - especially when it came‚Ä¶

This is fine. It's cute. It's just not for me - especially as an almost-thirty year old in 2025. The lacrosse plot in particular feels so random and last minute... why was this suddenly a sports movie at the end...???

Pleasantly surprised by this one, especially considering the low average. Might be overrating it some, but I thought it was interesting and didn‚Äôt overstay its welcome. Also Britt Lower. Hard to say much more without spoiling, so I won‚Äôt.

I went intoHeart Eyeswith incredibly low expectations, so it didn‚Äôt have to do much to impress me. There‚Äôs definitely stuff that doesn‚Äôt work here, both narratively and in terms of the movie‚Äôs comedy writing, but I was surprised by how often the humordidwork for me, and the premise was uniquely fun until the killer reveal.

I remembered loving this when it initially came out in 2014, but I removed my rating a couple years ago because I had a feeling my opinion may change if I rewatched it. Unfortunately, that gut instinct was correct. While this has a few stand out funny scenes, it is far too long for what it is.They Came Togetheris SNL Digital Short material, or Funny or Die material, ‚Ä¶definitely not feature length movie material.Shout out to Melanie Lynskey hosting a Halloween party dressed as a vampire though. 10/10.

kind of shocked they didn‚Äôt make this into a series. maybe it‚Äôs just too expensive to set up a whole escape room every time? but hellevator managed to make it work and i can‚Äôt imagine the game show network was pulling in big bucks.
Kind of a miracle this works as well as it does. There‚Äôs definitely some aspects I could‚Äôve done without, but it‚Äôs a fun little movie.
very stupid movie, but Ididlaugh

The premise of this film is darkly absurd and immediately drew me in but, as it went on, it became a bit too densely packed with ideas - many of which I felt I may not have had full context for. I can certainly respect and appreciate the film on some level, but my personal enjoyment of it dwindled the longer it went on.Perhaps a bit sacrilegious and missing the point, I know, but I‚Äôd love to see a‚Ä¶

kind of funny to have beef with some teenager even if that beef is 100% foundedI think this is playing with a lot of interesting ideas, but I don‚Äôt know that I was always on board for the execution. Everyone sucks here. Thankfully that makes for a pretty thrilling movie by the end, but it‚Äôs also one that I probably won‚Äôt think about much after tonight.

Last of the movies playing at the museum (for now). This one is naturally 20 minutes and hasn‚Äôt been cut down from 40/45 but‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know, maybe it should have been cut down from 20. Kinda slow paced and boring, especially for a museum movie primarily meant to appeal to kids and their parents.

Companionis working with ideas that have been done a hundred times over, but the writing and performances are enough to keep it interesting. Some really interesting dynamics here, both in terms of the characters we see on screen and the implied wider world of the film. Fun ending too.

Kind of torn on this. A lot I like, but I‚Äôm not sure about the ending and the pregnancy angle feels invented solely to accommodate Alia‚Äôs real life pregnancy. The romance worked better for the plot than I imagined though, and I still think the concept of setting a movie in one of these fake war cities is interesting.Kind of underutilized Chlo√´ Sevigny and Tim Heidecker. Their characters and dynamic were a lot of fun in a darkly comedic way, but they just don‚Äôt have enough screentime or relevance.

When I was a kid I was really into sharks and saw a few nature documentaries like this. Some in IMAX, some direct to video, some at aquariums. Haven‚Äôt seen many since then though, and it‚Äôs been almost two decades. ‚Ä¶So my biggest takeaway watching this new documentary is that it‚Äôs crazy impressive just how much cameras have improved since then. The detail we can see on these animals is incredible. The pacing isn‚Äôt the greatest, but you can probably‚Ä¶

Wolf Manis really effective in its transformation and chase sequences, but unfortunately falls short in other areas. I liked the literal ending shot, but thought the ending in particular could have been better executed. Kind of felt like they weren't sure where to take it after the big reveal in the final act. Wish the final wolf design was a bit wolf-ier as well. Otherwise a pretty cool movie though.
Lars and the Real Rabbitfun premise, but it kinda drops the ball on the execution

I recently got a box office job with a museum that plays this and got to watch it during my shift today so that I could better explain what it's about to guests.Apparently there was initially a forty-five minute cut of it that played at other(?) museums, but it was cut down to around twenty - I assume to make it an easier sell to casual museum guests. If I had to guess at what was cut, I'd imagine‚Ä¶

The Listenneerrrr‚Ä¶.This film has an interesting concept, and Tessa Thompson gives a good performance, but I‚Äôm not sure it ever justifies its format. This could have just as easily been a podcast. An engaging podcast though.

This rules.I (like many Americans apparently) wasn‚Äôt really familiar with Robbie Williams or his boy band Take That, so I had no expectations, but it all comes together really well regardless of prior knowledge. The ‚Äúmonkey‚Äù (chimp) was unironically a great decision, as was the choice to never acknowledge the fact that he‚Äôs a chimp throughout the movie. Beyond the unique protagonist choice, it follows a pretty standard music biopic formula, but it‚Äôs still a movie that‚Äôs as fun as it is (surprisingly!) emotionally moving. Amazing visuals too. Just a good time at the movies.
Wow that was obnoxious. Glad Shane Black mostly got over what ever that was beforeThe Nice Guys. Or maybe Ryan Gosling is just more charming than Robert Downey Jr.

I was trying to rentTen Cents a Dancebecause it sounded fun but they accidentally gave me this because it was on the same DVD set and I didn‚Äôt notice until I went to put it in my DVD player just now. But I watched it anyway. Movie‚Äôs fine.

Pleasantly surprised by this! I think it helped that I didn't really have any expectations for it, but it was a lot of fun. Far gorier than I imagined it would be too, with some cool horror effects. The teeth designs in this are particularly gnarly, but they work well for the film's tone and altered vampire lore.

Some good cinematography, some interesting scenes, but I was left wanting more from it. Kinda thought it would be crazier. I think I‚Äôd have liked it more if I‚Äôd been able to better invest in the characters and their relationship.
Really liked the basic premise and opening, but it kind of lost me in the second half. I feel like I might have a better understanding of it if I was familiar with its source material.

Fun movie, but I‚Äôm not sure there‚Äôs much more to say here. Some points are so ridiculous that they feel explicitly satirical of the thriller/horror genre, but I think I would‚Äôve liked it a little more had it leaned fully into that tone or stuck to something strictly serious. Looks amazing though.

Honestly, there‚Äôs nothing here that is particularly revolutionary - in fact, much of the jury deliberation calls to mind12 Angry Men- but I was captivated nonetheless. An edge of your seat moral dilemma drama with a solid cast and good pacing. Maybe it helped that I knew very little about the film going in, making its basic plot feel like a fun ‚Äútwist.‚ÄùVery funny though that there‚Äôs a moment where Toni Collette's character googles ‚Äò[another character‚Äôs name]‚Äôs husband‚Äô and literally every result is photos of the correct people. Kind of convinced me that Clint Eastwood has never googled anything before.

movietitle: A Day at the Disney Studios
review: Just an advertisement for MGM Studios / Hollywood Studios (which is weirdly referred to as "Disney Studios" throughout). It's fun to see Mickey and co. on some now-defunct rides, especially The Great Movie Ride, but otherwise there's not much here that you can't find in old recorded ride videos.Interestingly though, I've taken some pretty zoomed in photos of the Bean Bunny animatronic in MuppetVision 3D and the version in this promotional video actually looks way more detailed. I'm curious if he got replaced over the years? Or if it was just a special doll made for this video?
THAT'S how you make a movie! I do wish I could make it so that every default copy of the movie had the first endingas listed on Wikipediathough.
kept expecting this to go somewhere or for something interesting to be revealed. guess that‚Äôs my fault.

Saw this in theaters, which had me questioning how I missed out on seeing it in theaters when it initially came out. I guess it didn‚Äôt play near me..?Anyway‚Ä¶ I do think the big screen does this movie some favors. From a cinematography standpoint it looks amazing, and the music rocks. I could do without some of the subplots, largely because I find them pretty unnecessary and distracting from the built tension, but otherwise this is a pretty solid‚Ä¶
mostly harmless, but it drags....

greta gerwig‚Äôs first acting credit is uhmmm‚Ä¶ not that great. (understatement) also she‚Äôs barely in it.I love plenty of mumblecore stuff but this level of no budget, ‚Äúrealistic‚Äù 2000‚Äôs mumblecore is rarely my thing unfortunately.
kinda changed the game

Shockingly cringey. It's like if that speech America Ferrera made inBarbiewas delivered through narration fifty times over and instead of being an innocent speech about the struggles of being a woman it veered off course into weird gender essentialism and the inherent godliness of being a mother. There are far better movies tackling the same subject. Cool body horror though.
crazy how expressive and fluidly animated these characters are. gromit and feathers mcgraw are particularly impressive‚Ä¶ they convey so much emotion and intent without dialogue. also pretty funny.
can‚Äôt say I see what everyone else seems to be seeing in this‚Ä¶ sorry‚Ä¶
the lighting and coloring in this movie is crazy good‚Ä¶everything should look like this

Somewhere between a 3 and 3.5. I enjoyed it, and was genuinely surprised by its twist, but it just leans a bit too corny for my taste. I‚Äôve seen similar sentiments played out better. Good performances though.

Absolutely no surprise that the guy playing Spazz-O was seemingly never in anything else. The concept here is generally fine, and there are some funny lines here and there, but it‚Äôs just way too obnoxious to work. Also Debbie Harry is NOT in enough of this movie enough to be one of the only two characters on the poster.Best bit is the follow-up credit cards.

This starts a bit slow, with a bit of a lengthy trial intro that dumps the basics of what you need to know about the case, but once the film turns its focus towards Kelly-Anne (and Clementine) things get interesting. Had no idea what her end goal was at any point of the film, ...which is fun!

The concept ofIt‚Äôs What‚Äôs Insideis really interesting, so I‚Äôm disappointed to say that I found the execution to be pretty lacking. Things definitely pick up once a crime happens ‚Ä¶but that‚Äôs well over an hour into the film. idk‚Ä¶ I just wasn‚Äôt given enough time to get to know these characters to be at all invested in their relationship dramas. I could barely keep up with who was who anyway.

Timothee was very good in this, but I didn‚Äôt really care for much else. Written and shot like any other biopic, and I felt like I needed to have read at least five Wikipedia articles on folk music before entering the theater to have a full understanding and appreciation of what was going on.

Really loved a lot of this. It‚Äôs well acted and surprisingly funny. There‚Äôs some weird decisions in terms of editing and score that I wasn‚Äôt really feeling, but it didn‚Äôt detract too much from the overall film. Cool movie.
Beautifully animated and with incredible sound design, but I kinda didn‚Äôt care about the story‚Ä¶

RaMell Ross‚Äôs first feature was a documentary film, which I think translates well into this unique historical drama, whose beautifully shot fictionalized narrative plays in direct conversation with our past. First person perspective, archival footage, and still imagery is used to paint a harrowing portrait of two boys at the Nickel Academy reform ‚Äúschool,‚Äù which is more concerned with using the boys as free prison labor than it is educating them in any capacity.Completely unlike any historical drama (or‚Ä¶

Obviously this isn't the fault of the movie, but I think all of the hypeChallengersreceived over the course of this year was to its detriment...because I'm underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong, it's a great movie, but I was left wanting more out of it. Maybe I just don't care about tennis (or this particular love triangle).
this was mostly fine but it felt at least an hour longer than the actual runtime - never a good sign
Heartbreakingly beautiful. Ironically makes me want to get back into making art more consistently.

This has been in my watchlist for a little while now but I struggled to find a copy with subs that synced up well. Finally got the chance to watch it as a DVD rental from Alamo Drafthouse‚Äôs Video Vortex, but I just couldn‚Äôt get into it. Not sure if I just wasn‚Äôt in the right mood or if this is something that would‚Äôve never worked for me, but I wasn‚Äôt a fan.

I have to be honest - prior to watching this film pretty much everything I knew about this musical was either fromGleeor just being aware ofThe Wizard of Oz. With that in mind, I‚Äôd been interested inWickedsince its release, but was apprehensive about its seemingly bloated runtime and washed out color palette. Thankfully, I am pleased to report that, although I do think it could have used a bit of a saturation boost in some‚Ä¶

movietitle: Blondie: The Best of Musikladen Live
review: The three stars are entirely for Blondie themselves, because there‚Äôs not really anything exciting going on here cinematically. Cool to see them perform some songs I haven‚Äôt heard a lot though.

Interesting movie. There‚Äôs moments I really liked here, but as a whole I just couldn‚Äôt get on board with it.¬†The sister is particularly obnoxious - to the point that I just did not care what happened to her.

This is a movie that‚Äôs been recommended to me by a few different people probably a hundred times over but I kept putting it off - half because of the runtime and half because I‚Äôve never been Christopher Nolan‚Äôs biggest fan. Have to say this is definitely my favorite of Nolan‚Äôs though. Maybe seeing it on an IMAX screen swayed me, but the visuals were spectacular and I really liked the film‚Äôs central characters.I‚Äôm not a huge fan of‚Ä¶

Hard for me to rate this because the DVD started pausing/skipping towards the end. I generally liked most of it though. Very mumblecore, which always relies on the actors and their delivery of the dialogue to keep things interesting.
This was fine. Expected to like it a lot more than I did.

Such a strange movie. JustTotally Killerif it was worse.The killer motivation barely makes sense with what we've been shown, and feels thrown together for shock value, while the music (though I enjoyed it) often felt kind of incongruent with the scenes they accompanied. Like...So Yesterdayfor Lucy stepping into 2003 for the first time? Just because it has yesterday in the title I guess? AndTeenage Dirtbagfor a makeover sequence where the outfits are more akin to a Disney Channel star than anything resembling that song's aesthetic?I wasn't bored though. Decent mindless entertainment. Whateverrr.

Working on writing something fun! That‚Äôs all I can really say right now, but the project caused me to rewatch this with the commentary track - which I‚Äôve actually listened to before (many times, even) but yeeeaarrss ago. Anyway. Cool movie.

Didn‚Äôt have any interest in this until someone told me it was one of the funniest movies they watched this year. I don‚Äôt know if I completely agree with that, but itwasreally great. I‚Äôm living for the pope drama.

I really wasn't expectingA Bad Moms Christmasto be so...serious? I think it's an angle that has potential, but it just did not work out for me here. The humor isn't much better either. And it's a shame, because I do really like this cast. How are you wasting Susan Sarandon and Christine Baranski??
This is...fine? I didn't hate it anyway. The twist is probably the most interesting aspect of the film ...but then it keeps going for another 60 minutes.
The dialogue and line delivery in this movie are truly on another level. I still have yet to see another comedy as simplistic as this one executed so well.

Great early performance from Joseph Gordon-Levitt here, but it's impossible for me to overlook some bafflingly bad decisions in the film's final act. I do like the core premise though, and wish it had been handled differently. It's a film that frustratingly feels just a few steps away from being something really great.
This has an ending that made me think ‚Äònow what was the point ofthat‚Äô several times over, but I can‚Äôt say I wasn‚Äôt entertained.
Sorry to Jennifer Jason Leigh but Baumbach movies got a lot better during and after the co-written by Greta Gerwig era...

Incredibly sweet in the most bittersweet way. This didn‚Äôt move me emotionally to the degree ofMary & Max- I think, ironically, because the amount of horrific things happening was a littletoomuch - but I enjoyed it regardless. Much likeMary & Maxbefore it, the characters are incredibly charming in a way that is quirky (but not ‚Äúcringey‚Äù) with realistic flaws and lovably memorable designs. It‚Äôs clear Adam Elliot has a lot of affection for his characters, even‚Ä¶

This story is so baffling to me. My friends and I watched 20 minutes of footage from the original show last week - taken from just the first month or so - and that alone was difficult to watch despite being edited down. To know people saw this man live-streamed 24/7 when he was at his worst? That they bought and read his diaries? And still laughed about it to his face like it was all one long joke?? Absolutely surreal. The studio should be thankful he didn‚Äôt sue them for everything they had.

There are certainly a few real world parallels, but ultimately there is no real exploration of why or how this divided country came to be or the motivation of the journalist protagonists beyond getting a good quote or image. movietitle: UFOs and Nukes - The Secret Link Revealed
review: can't deny thatOppenheimerwould have been more fun if there were some random flying saucers in the background...

I meant to watch this the weekend it came out and, at the same time, catch up with the other two remaining movies I have to watch in order to complete Meredith Hagner‚Äôs (released) filmography but‚Ä¶I had 0 motivation to do so.Vacation Friends 2is fine. It‚Äôs not a flawless start to my 2024 movie watching, but not a totally bad one either. It‚Äôs mindless summer fun‚Ä¶ with an added dose of Steve Buscemi. I like the characters/actors well enough, even if the jokes rarely land.

I knew very little going into this beyond its vague plot description and its director. I love bothShopliftersandNobody Knowsa lot, but was worried that this one might not live up to Kore-eda's former films as it wasn't written by him. Thankfully, it's equally as great.It's impressive how often this switches perspectives, and thus gives a new twist on the same story, and yet none of those twists feel intentionally crafted to shock the viewers. They're‚Ä¶

Occasionally funny, but its original songs are forgettable and its plot nothing special. I don‚Äôt think(?) this is based on any pre-existing Dahl work, but it definitely feels like one - for better or worse.

movietitle: Curse of the Man Who Sees UFOs
review: The director‚Äôs narration is kind of giving youtube essayist here but the story is interesting and told with genuine passion. It‚Äôs clear Christo‚Äôs willingness to believe is, in part, fueled by a series of tragedies in his life, but it doesn‚Äôt matter too much in the grand scheme of things. The director seems to think similarly, which is always good. You probablycouldfind the origin of the lights if you dug hard enough, but Christo‚Äôs explanation, and dedication, is ultimately the better story.
charming modern romcom with fantastic cinematography. not much more to say about it!

I have some reservations about the pacing here, and how quickly Mister is forgiven and welcomed back by everyone, but Danielle Brooks and Fantasia were amazing. The musical numbers add a nice balance between hope and tragedy, as well as some visual flair that‚Äôs not as prominent in the more straightforward original film adaptation.
Mostly pretty traditional in its approach to a biopic, and the ending gets a bit corny, but it‚Äôs a solid, emotional story with some really good performances.

First half sets up a decently interesting mystery with some great interview sound bites from the now-adult child witnesses, but the available information gets stretched a bit thin by the end of the doc‚Äôs short runtime.

I was under the impression that this would be a more traditional biopic, so I was surprised when I realized that I was halfway through and it was still playing out in "real time" at a single location. The hectic, claustrophobic setting and initial lack of clarity works well to up the tension, and Sydney Sweeney is great.

movietitle: John Was Trying to Contact Aliens
review: Big fan of the part where he tells any ETs listening to his music that he‚Äôll be back again at 9pm. Not even all of Earth has the same time zone!Genuinely sweet doc tho.
I really enjoyed the first half of this, as well as the initial twist reveal, but I think this really squanders its potential with its abrupt ending.

Unrelenting anxiety born from an out of control situation ‚Ä¶with a score to match! It‚Äôs somewhat reminiscent ofShiva Babyin that way, though in every other aspect it is entirely its own thing. Not sure how I feel about the ending, but otherwise really great film that makes its simplistic school story work as a captivating thriller.

I think if Alia hugged me like Callie hugged Jacqueline at the end of this movie it would fix every issue I had in life maybe.Jokes aside, this is such a heart-wrenching watch. There‚Äôs a constant kind of anticipation that Callie will act as some kind of American/Western savior of Jacqueline but it‚Äôs far more realistic and grounded than a movie that would have gone that route would be. There‚Äôs no idealized happy ending, just two very different people‚Ä¶

If they bring back Lucy Saxon before they bring back Martha Jones I'm going to scream. Just ftr. But this was a good time when I didn't have to hear Neil Patrick Harris's attempts at different accents. I was on the fence about whether or not I was going to start watchingDoctor Whoagain after these specials, but Ncuti's Doctor seems like a lot of fun. Will probably give it a shot.
this doesn't seem like a miniseries but, sure, i‚Äôll log it. review onserializd.
Some great little guys in this one. Watched the English dub.
Pretty cool original concept, but the execution of its more overt horror elements made it feel kind of generic. First half is pretty great at playing up the tension and mystery of it all though.

Fun and unique concept for a movie, presumably based on theThis Manmeme/event. It‚Äôs darkly funny, and has some great cinematography, but I‚Äôm not sure how much I liked its eventual hard lean into the cancel culture angle. It definitely works for the story they‚Äôre telling - it‚Äôs not executed poorly or anything - but I thought it kind of watered down the promising premise to being something that‚Äôs kind of become overdone in media of all types.

Uncomfortably captivating.It‚Äôs kind of genius and ironic to have a film like this be loosely based on an actual relationship. It‚Äôs a commentary on the adaptation of real peoples‚Äô trauma and complexities while simultaneously (to some extent) being what it criticizes - but in a way that somehow works. You can revel in its drama, but it only leaves a discomforting and bittersweet aftertaste by the time the credits roll.
Super silly at times, but equally as fun. Great concept to really utilize these actors and let them have the spotlight (again).

Fantastic ending, but I wasn't entirely sold on everything preceding it. For every interesting scene/plot development there was another that made me wish the film was significantly shorter. ...like, Jay and Ralph's plotlines added to the film's central thesis in significant ways, but I don't know that the helicopter trip needed to be that long? Among other things. Al Pacino was really great though.

The aesthetics are nice, and there‚Äôs a decent amount of darkly funny lines, but by the time the credits rolled it all felt a bit pointless. It failed to make me truly invest in any of its characters, failed at any meaningful kind of class commentary, and feels pretty uninspired when viewed as nothing more than a ‚Äúshocking‚Äù twist thriller. The performances by Rosamund Pike, Richard E. Grant, and (briefly) Carey Mulligan are pretty fun though, and help to make up for the lackluster script.

Like withTheater Campbefore it, I didnt really expect much from this but it ended up really surprising me. Love Angus. Great performances all around from the small core cast.There‚Äôs definitely been a few stand-outs but, after what felt like a string of middling first watch films these past few months, this andHunger Gameswere really refreshing. Movies are back, baby!!

movietitle: The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes
review: A lot longer than I expected it to be (didn‚Äôt look at the runtime) but the length felt deserved by the end. Maybe the bestHunger Gamesmovie, in spite of my Johanna Mason bias. Really interesting as both a high stakes blockbuster for a major franchise and a more intimate character study of an awful man. The echoes of the original films/books just gives their narratives even more weight.

that‚Äôs my special little guys right there‚Ä¶ (julie and roxie)not wasting my time writing a review here bc it has the potential to get a second season and be removed. i have a spoilery reviewover on serializd.

It‚Äôs actually kind of crazy how much the case at the center of this film is genderswappedThe Staircase. A writer whose spouse allegedly falls to their death? Who is revealed to be bisexual and having affairs (that the accused claims her husband largely knew about) during the course of the trial?Ironically, this fictional story has less engaging twists and turns than its real life counterpart. The addition of a blind child witness conflicted about the true nature of his father‚Äôs death is definitely interesting though, and his arc ended up being the best part of the film for me.

Super interesting premise (on Letterboxd), and some unique visuals, but as a whole this was not for me. I was admittedly expecting something less experimental, but I don't know that having the right mindset would have helped much.

movietitle: 15 Things You Didn't Know About Bigfoot
review: Fun idea with a lackluster execution. Most of the jokes don‚Äôt land and it has barely any scares to speak of. It‚Äôs generally fine though‚Ä¶ far from the worst thing I‚Äôve seen. Just not really my thing.

This has such a devastating ending, but one that thankfully doesn‚Äôt feelcruel. Perfectly imperfect and incredibly charming.Usually heavily narrated stuff doesn‚Äôt work well for me, but it felt appropriate here to mirror the aesthetic of a more kid friendly claymation.

Somehow one of the worst documentaries I‚Äôve ever seen. It‚Äôs like someone at Build-A-Bear saw the Beanie Babies documentaries and decided their company needed one even though they had ‚Äúbear‚Äù-ly any story to tell. The whole thing is narrated by someone holding a build a bear and doing a voice. Occasionally making bear jokes. Far too long.Unnecessary segments in this documentary include (but are not limited to): (1) a lengthy explanation of what malls are framed as if malls‚Ä¶
Really fun little modern mystery movie! I admittedly figured out the film‚Äôs biggest twist pretty early into the runtime, but the smaller twists and turns along the way kept it interesting.

This has some pretty cool imagery, and even better sound design, and Kaitlyn Dever is giving a great no dialogue performance... but overall it didn't really do much for me. The tension and intrigue is definitely there in the beginning, but the further it went the more disconnected I felt from it.

This was the perfect midnight watch for the night before Halloween. I remembered liking it, but not much beyond that. As I said in my first review (years ago now...) the ads do get a bit annoying towards the end of the movie, but I appreciate the feeling of authenticity throughout. All of the commercials feel like they really could be low budget local commercials, and the writing for the newscasters is similarly pitch perfect. It feels a lot more tongue-in-cheek and playful when compared to the better knownGhostwatch, and I appreciate it for that.

movietitle: Seven Stages to Achieve Eternal Bliss
review: unfunny and feels significantly longer than it is. regret deciding to watch this at 1:30am.

Interesting to revisit this after seven years, six sequels, a remake, and 2.5 seasons of a TV show.Chucky is way more sinister and calculated here. He‚Äôs still a killer doll, obviously, and that‚Äôs still funny at times, but this first film is way more grounded in a kind of twisted version of our reality. Charles Lee Ray is a serial killer with set motivations and targets, with his now-usual quips being few and far between. All the biting paired‚Ä¶

Pretty fun to watch, but not much more than that. Reminds me of theFinal Destinationmovies in that way. Any commentary this attempts to make about capitalism or class is kind of overshadowed by its sheer amount of goofy jumpscares and situations.Ididadmittedly know the ending prior to watching though so...it was difficult to invest in the characters with that knowledge.

Not much here in terms of narrative, but what is here works well to build an interesting world and atmosphere. I‚Äôm not into the human designs, but i loveee all of the different creatures and how they interact with each other.Just caught up with the first six episodes of the show based on this on HBO Max calledScavenger‚Äôs Reign. It has all of the unique elements of this short‚Äôs world while adding some really compelling human storylines. Worth a watch if you‚Äôre into sci-fi and dramatic adult animation.
A surreal, darkly comedic mockumentary about St. Vincent that delves into the complexities of celebrity and public image? Why didn‚Äôt I watch this sooner?

Haveyoubeen to Universal Studios?I'm honestly undecided about how much I liked this. A lot of it was dumb, but it was a fun kind of dumb, and I genuinely laughed at a lot of the banter. Sure, the horror/slasher element leaves a lot to be desired, and the narrative feels a bit messy, but I mostly enjoyed it...?This was actually one of the older things in my watchlist ...and then I took it out while sifting‚Ä¶

Bisexual manic pixie dream girl cautionary tale. Or something. Usually I don‚Äôt mind when not much happens in a movie, but the characters have got to be compelling to watch. Everyone here feels pretty generic and detached. Natalia Dyer is pretty good, but she needed a bit more to work with to truly shine.

This feels...a little disjointed. The majority of the film plays out like a traditional behind the scenes documentary. Nothing special, but it has some interesting insight into the movies. It's not until the last third that it actually delves into the angle promised by its title/description (i.e. what it was like to grow up "with Chucky"). After that it pivots again to discuss the fandom, both ofChild's Playand of horror in general.I think the "growing up with‚Ä¶
Went into this a bit worried about the runtime. It definitely feelslong, but nowhere near the length it is. Equally enthralling and devastating from beginning to end. Easy best picture contender.
Barbie (2023) for aliens who sacrifice men to the void

This is cute. My rating is almost entirely for the new character animation and interactions. Particularly liked the puppies watching Fantasia and Moana helping Flounder. AlsoBongoin the group shot!!!I thought the opening live action sequence felt very stiff in both writing and acting. Like the kind of thing that would play as an advertisement for the Disney Parks in your hotel room at the Disney Parks. Not sure why it was necessary at all when they could‚Ä¶
This kind of lost me at the end, but overall a decent, bittersweet little sci-fi movie. Love the gimmick/aesthetic of Cameron and Erin's kid's show.

I had every intention of watchingThe Evil Dead(1981) prior to watching this one but it just...didn't happen. I have seenEvil Dead IIthough and, although it's been a while since I watched it, I think it comes out on top if only by a small margin. The characters here just do nothing for me personally. Ash is at least charismatic and enjoyable to watch.Some of the visuals here are cool, particularly Mia's final blood-soaked chainsaw scenes,‚Ä¶

I guess I should probably preface this by saying I don't hold the originalExorcistin very high regard. When I watched it for the first time five years ago I thought it was pretty good, but ultimately too edgy and too corny/unintentionally funny for me to fully invest in. While my opinion might change if I rewatched it today, I didn't really go into this with any kind of expectations. I think that definitely helped it. ...Also probably helped‚Ä¶

movietitle: A Nightmare on Elm Street: The Dream Child
review: Probably the most ridiculous premise thus far. The comic book kill is a pretty cool visual though‚Ä¶ if you ignore Super Freddy.

Decided to watch this one first because the plot of it seemed the most interesting to me. The set design and framing here are unsurprisingly great, but I wasn‚Äôt into the over-narration. I get that it adds to the style Anderson was going for, but it just kind of annoyed me.

this is what the general public in search party season 3 imagined happened to keithCapture Kill Releaseis a decent concept that works better than it probably should primarily because of its lead actors. Their individual emotions about the situation feel authentic, even when the writing leans over the top.

This is the onlyPurgemovie I hadn‚Äôt seen yet so I figured I should finish out the franchise (sans TV series). I like the general concept of these movies, but the execution of this one is pretty lacking and the characters kind of generic. Maybe it plays better if you actually watch them in order. Oops.

Pretty fun movie with a solid cast, but not much more than that. Although it definitely highlights peoples reasons for buying into the stock and the "power to the people" message of the movement, it consistently prioritizes comedy to any meaningful commentary. The snappy editing keeps things moving at a good pace though, and there are some genuine laughs to be had here. Pretty accurate depiction of how obnoxious Reddit can be too.

Not as bad as I thought it‚Äôd be, but the bar was pretty low. It‚Äôs better than something likeThe Hungover Gamesif only because its focus on parodying a single franchise means it has a followable plot. Still pretty nothing tho. Low hanging fruit jokes for a franchise I‚Äôve never seen. Ironically I think it would have played worse if I‚Äôd actually seen aFast & Furiousmovie before.
I was entertained.

I‚Äôve been wanting to watch this one for a while because the description seems so in line with the type of films I usually like, but it ended up being a bit too slow-paced for me. It might work better on a different day or at a different time. (it‚Äôs almost 2am) At the moment tho - good, but not great. (to me!)Also: this is my 4000th logged movie on Letterboxd!?!? a movie that makes youwishyou were watching a Lifetime movie with the same plot

movietitle: Better Call Saul Presents: Slippin' Jimmy

Yeah, I dunno. I try to avoid these live action Disney movies for a reason. They do very little for me. This one plays with its original animated story in interesting ways - I like that Eric is also a collector and they‚Äôre able to bond over their shared desire for adventure, for example - but overall I‚Äôm just not impressed.It‚Äôs been said a million times over but the underwater scenes are either so dark/grey that they appear lifeless‚Ä¶
Not all of the jokes here hit but it‚Äôs good dumb fun. PJ and Josie are so real.

This kind of did nothing for me narratively (sorry). The puppetry is good -it's Henson!- but I wasn't always into the character designs here either. The costuming for the human leads is pretty magnificent though, and there's some undeniably cool set designs.
the only thing consistently holding my attention in this movie was the whacky score

Far from the worst thing I've seen. Ending was honestly better than I expected it to be given the set up, but the first half of the movie is pretty painfully unfunny regardless. Definitely underutilized Rachel Bloom.Funniest bit is John Reynolds' character arguing with his wife about his shampoo because he didn't know it was pear scented (he thought the pear was just a mascot).

There was no need for the timeline ofThe Beanie Bubbleto be as convoluted as it was. Also...gotta say. The collectors are far more interesting subjects of the beanie craze than those in the Ty offices.

I don't really remember much about theBeanie Maniadocumentary released in 2021, but from what I do remember (and from looking at my review) this doc seems far less manufactured/promotional, focusing all of its energy on the beanie fans and workers rather than any of the higher up corporate people who profited off of the fad.Lina Trivedi, who is credited here as coming up with the birthday/poem concept while she was working for Ty as a college student, is kind of an icon.

yo thisBlade Runnerprequel sucks!thought it couldn‚Äôt get any worse but then the big moral lesson about Modern Day Society hits you over the head with a giant cartoon hammer at the end. the lead actors are fine but some of the side characters (particularly the boss) are not great and do not help the lackluster script.
ngl I kinda thought this was gonna be a funny goofy time for some reason. ...it was not. this dude's ex wife sounds like sadness fromInside Outthough.

I'll be honest. I watched this movie because Parker Posey cited it as inspiration for herJosie and the Pussycatscharacter. With this in mind, it's impossible not to see the similarities between the two films, particularly in their approaches to satirizing the modern music industry, but I thinkJosiedoes a better job of making you care about its characters. Pretty basic plot and characters that feel rushed by the film's hour long runtime. Some of the character designs are fun, but I didn't feel like the art style was anything to write home about otherwise.
Imagine my shock when the Sanrio logo popped up before this movie...

I never watchedBatman: The Animated Series, but this felt like what I imagine an episode of the series to be like...only much longer. It's well-written, and has a surprisingly good exploration of grief and revenge in spite of its age demographic, but I could never really get invested in the story. Batman is truly the least interestingBatmancharacter to me.
Good concept and some pretty gnarly possession scenes, but ultimately left me wanting a bit more. Sophie Wilde was great though.

Dumb fun. Which is exactly what you'd want from aBeavis and Butt-Headmovie. It's a shame that the TV show (or, at least, the first two seasons of it) has such a heavy focus on the boys just watching and commenting on music videos, because it's so much more entertaining to watch them as clueless protagonists thrust into ridiculous scenarios.

Couldn‚Äôt remember what possessed me to put this in my watchlist despite its low rating until Cassandra Peterson‚Äôs character showed up.This has a pretty goodScoobystory concept and a few fun film/Hollywood jokes, but ultimately doesn‚Äôt do enough with the LEGO concept to justify the jarring style.

The atomic bomb sequence is just as devastating as its reputation would lead you to believe, and the art throughout is incredible, but the dramatic tone shifts don‚Äôt really work for me. I get why they happen, to contrast Gen‚Äôs childlike innocence and joy with the destruction around him, but it‚Äôs difficult to fully connect to a story that has such severe tonal whiplash. Maybe it works better as a written/drawn story divided by chapters.

The Letterboxd description for this movie is soo vague that I didn‚Äôt really have any idea what I was getting into with this. I definitely would have watched it sooner if I had known more of the plot!Super interesting documentary about a strange situation with some funDaria-style animation.

I put this off for a bit because the art style didn‚Äôt really appeal to me. Something about it just feels so blocky and unfinished. I got used to it while watching, but I still don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm totally sold on it.That aside, this was pretty good. Certainly one of the better executed animated allegories for ostracized people and systemic bigotry, particularly in the case of Nimona‚Äôs backstory.Nimona herself can be a bit annoying at times, and‚Ä¶

movietitle: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem
review: This was really cute! I‚Äôve never seen or read any prior Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles stuff, so I can‚Äôt really speak on this from an adaptation perspective, but I really liked what they did with the characters here. Cumulatively the pop culture and brand references get to be a little excessive, but it made sense for the characters, and the humor worked for me more often than in comparable modern animated family movies.The animation style of this is really‚Ä¶

"Well, gotta go! Animation's expensive!"This is...all over the place. To the point that I'm genuinely not sure what the point of it all is or even who it's for.The opening sequence seems like it might be promotion for Disney's MGM Studios, but that thread is dropped as quickly as it's introduced in favor of... Minnie trying to teach a nerd to be cool? I guess? Although her "lessons" in being cool (and not harassing women) largely consist of‚Ä¶

I didn‚Äôt really have any expectations for this at all so my liking it this much was a pleasant surprise. Equal parts funny and heartfelt with a solid cast. Glad I watched in a theater full of people who were really into it.

This is one of those movies that I can recognize as being technically impressive, but which narratively didn‚Äôt really do anything for me. The first hour or so in particular felt very by the books biopic in a way that was a chore to sit through. And while I think the filmdoesget gradually better as it goes along, I never felt emotionally moved by its story or performances. The objective weight of the film‚Äôs narrative and its ramifications‚Ä¶
Exactly what you‚Äôd expect it to be - nothing more, nothing less. Greta Gerwig is there though, which is always a plus.

A really sweet and fun time! Margot, America, and Ryan are all great in their respective roles and really make this movie what it is. The set and costume design is also absolutely immaculate in its purposeful, beautiful, artifice.Greta Gerwig definitely wears her inspirations on her sleeve but I think the film is ultimately better for it. Just one example of many, but when I sawPlaytimein her inspirations list a few days back I was a little‚Ä¶

review: "that's what feminism is!!"
this all could have been avoided if they just slept with the lights on after she met with that woman. or, like, bought some flashlights.

Kind of a nothing movie for me. It‚Äôs part exploitation sleeze and part hyperbolic warning about a perceived rise in violence in youth culture. The characters in this are so flat and two-dimensional that even the more extreme violence doesn‚Äôt really have any significant impact.Admittedly I was multitasking while watching, but I can‚Äôt imagine paying it my full, undivided attention would have radically changed my perception of it.

movietitle: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie
review: I just finishedBreaking Badfor the first time this Wednesday, very aware that this movie existed, so I think I probably went in with a more open mind than those who watched the series finale as it aired in 2013. This movie is by no means anecessaryaddition to the story, but it‚Äôs a nice little epilogue for Jesse that both ties up some loose ends and shows us a little more of what life was like for him in captivity. I‚Äôm glad things weren‚Äôt too rough for him here. ..Comparatively, I mean. This man has suffered enough!!!

The comedy doesn‚Äôt always hit for me, and the ‚Äúemotional‚Äù scenes (esp. the opening kid scenes) often feel kind of corny or rushed, but the cast is likable and it never overstays its welcome. Admittedly I am not usually into these kinds of mainstream raunchy comedies.‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîNote to self: Tagging this with wlw, but for categorization purposes this is only for a single line Lolo says in the airport that implies she is bi/pansexual. It is not mentioned again after this. I assume the film is in the massive pride list because Deadeye‚Äôs actor is nonbinary.

Kind of all concept, no heart. Ironically I think it would have worked better as a TV show. As-is too much of the film's short runtime is focused on the making of the in-world show, meaning its late attempts to give the characters personal dramas off set feel jarring at best. The show they're making in this seems pretty bad even before the changes.

Cute feel-good movie about a real life lottery loophole. It probably wouldn't amount to much without its cast, but thankfully the key players are charming enough characters that it works.Accidentally did a lottery double feature with this andTo Leslie.
Simple but effective. Andrea Riseborough deserved the nom. Marc Maron sounds like he's putting on a weird accent though. (I eventually got used to it)

I went in with pretty low expectations for this one, but it was a fun time! Some weird effects and a lot of (ironically) dated references, but I liked the characters and the plot felt fresh for a vampire story. Cool to see a teen vampire movie that not only avoids the teen forever trope (they‚Äôre in their 20s) but actually shows its characters frustrated at being stuck the same age for eternity.About halfway through I started imagining a‚Ä¶
beep beep

Chasing Chasing Amyis kind of a testament to everything I love about film.Sometimes the films that speak to us the most, and make the biggest impact on our lives, don‚Äôt make sense on the surface.Chasing Amyis often dismissed in modern discussions about queer films, not only for its plot but for its cishet male perspective behind and in front of the camera, ‚Ä¶and yet it meant everything to this queer trans filmmaker. We can‚Äôt pick and‚Ä¶

Imagine being obsessed with a celebrity, devoting hours of your time each day to maintaining a fan site, and your partner leaves you for that very celebrity‚Ä¶ who they‚Äôve never even liked prior‚Ä¶ maybe the biggest L in romcom history.(I know Duncan cheated on Annie and they broke up before she and Tucker truly got together‚Ä¶ but the dynamic is still wild)

As a darkly comedic thrillerThe Oathis entertaining, but it fails to go far enough with any of its politics. Even "The Oath" itself isn't really explained or dealt with in any meaningful way, acting as a pretty vague point of conflict for the characters. Good cast though.

Fun Mom Dinnermay not be a super memorable cult classic in the making, but it‚Äôs a sweet and entertaining lighthearted comedy that never overstays its welcome. And I think that‚Äôs all it has to be?Toni Collette is always a joy to watch in comedies, and I loved Adam Scott, John Early, and Paul Rust‚Äôs respective roles (even if the latter two were pretty minor).99 Luftballons karaoke!!!

Wanda Sykes' obligatory Trump Jokes special ...though, to be fair to her, Trump jokes didn't take up the entirety of the runtime. There's a weird thought process here though where she brings up Russian tampering with the US election, and instead of making comedy out of questioning why we didn't investigate further or re-run the election she goes on some tangent about how everyone should have been boycotting Russian imports? Or just Russian-named things like Uber? Like she's joking, but‚Ä¶

This is less a movie and more a series of interviews. Worthwhile if you want to hear from the directors featured (which I did) but it offers very little in terms of actual direction or constructed narrative.Edit:Wait, I just found this was directed by the VP of First Run Features, who released most of the films highlighted here. Is this just a First Run Features advertisement masquerading as a film that cares about lesbian film history?!? I mean, the interviews are very real, and the directors themselves care, but... hm.

Interesting little time capsule into 80s-90s lesbian fashion, including an exploration of butch/femme dynamics of the time. Some stuff seems a bit dated, but I suppose that is the nature of such a time capsule. It's kind of surreal to think about how in 20-30 years footage of young adults from now will likely have the same feel to a younger generation.

movietitle: John Early: Now More Than Ever
review: Very all over the place in terms of quality, with some loosely strung together jokes that occasionally go on a bit too long - a hot mess, if you will - but it's fun. If Early put out another special tomorrow I'd watch it immediately.

This was fine. Unremarkable, but fine. Wish I liked this a bit more. It's an interesting look at the no wave world Jean-Michel Basquiat was a part of through a fictionalized lens, but once it starts focusing on music performances it feels like it becomes more of a weird concert film than anything else. It briefly goes back to the fanciful narrative afterwards, but at that point the plot has been lost so thoroughly that it's hard to get back into it.Its unconventional structure admittedly feels fitting for Basquiat's artistic style, but that style just didn't work for me on film.

I meant to watchDowntown '81, but when I checked Mubi for it by typing in 'Basquiat' this doc came up instead. (Which is fine because, for whatever reason, I had been under the impression thatDowntown '81was a documentary as well)The Radiant Childis a pretty informative snapshot of the artist and his rise to fame, including his struggles as a black artist doing unique, challenging work within the high art world.

movietitle: The Owl House: Watching and Dreaming
review: I may be rating this a little higher than it "deserves" given how much of it relies on montage and narration to wrap up the series' story and character arcs, but it's hard to imagine how else the crew would have been able to finish out the story in a satisfying way considering the shortened final season they were given. The animation is a step above the main series though, and works to make up for the rushed story. Everything is so fluid and expressive. Very fun.
